user.title: Climate Group Helper Configuration
user.description: Create a group of climate entities that can be controlled as a single unit. The group will aggregate temperature readings and synchronize control commands across all member devices.

data_description.name: Enter a descriptive name for this climate group (e.g., 'Living Room Climate' or 'Upstairs Heating').
data_description.entities: Select the climate devices to include in this group.
data_description.average_option: Choose the method for calculating the group's target temperature.
data_description.round_option: Select the rounding precision for temperature values.
data_description.temp_sensor: Select an optional external sensor to override the current temperature of the group.
data_description.hvac_mode_strategy: Choose the strategy for determining the group's HVAC mode.
data_description.expose_member_entities: Enable this to expose the list of member entities as a state attribute.

error.no_entities: At least one climate entity must be selected to create a group.
error.invalid_entity: One or more selected entities are not valid climate devices.
error.duplicate_name: A climate group with this name already exists.
error.unavailable_entities: Some selected entities are currently unavailable. The group will be created but may not function properly until all entities are available.

abort.already_configured: A climate group with this configuration already exists.
abort.single_instance_allowed: Only one climate group helper integration can be configured.
abort.no_changes: No changes were made to the configuration.

init.title: Configure Climate Group Options
init.description: Modify the settings for your climate group. Changes will take effect immediately and affect how temperatures are calculated and displayed.

data_description.entities: Add or remove climate entities from this group. Removing entities will exclude them from temperature calculations and control commands.
data_description.average_option: Change the method for calculating target temperatures across group members.
data_description.round_option: Adjust the temperature precision for the group.
data_description.temp_sensor: Select an optional external sensor to override the current temperature of the group.
data_description.hvac_mode_strategy: Choose the strategy for determining the group's HVAC mode.
data_description.expose_member_entities: Enable this to expose the list of member entities as a state attribute.

error.no_entities: At least one climate entity must remain in the group.
error.invalid_entity: One or more selected entities are not valid climate devices.
error.configuration_error: Unable to apply the new configuration. Please check your settings and try again.

abort.no_changes: No changes were detected in the configuration.

options.off_priority: Off Priority (Group is off if any member is off)

member_unavailable.title: Climate Group Member Unavailable
member_unavailable.description:
One or more members of climate group '{group_name}' are currently unavailable. The group will continue to function with available members, but some features may be limited.

Unavailable entities: {unavailable_entities}

no_members_available.description:
Climate group '{group_name}' has no available member entities. The group will be unavailable until at least one member entity becomes available.

Check the status of these entities: {member_entities}

conflicting_features.title: Climate Group Feature Conflicts
conflicting_features.description:
Climate group '{group_name}' contains members with incompatible features. Some functionality may be limited to features supported by all group members.

Conflicting entities: {conflicting_entities}
